The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' detections are the word 'hsl' (Hue-Saturation-Lightness color format) misidentified as crypto. content.user_title: Create complex HTML artifacts with React
content.value_statement: Building rich HTML artifacts for Claude conversations requires setup, dependencies, and bundling. This skill automates the entire workflow from project initialization to single-file bundle generation.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + TypeScript projects with Vite
Install and configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui theming
Bundle React apps into single self-contained HTML files
Configure path aliases for clean imports
Set up Parcel bundler with inlining support
limitations: Not suitable for simple single-file HTML artifacts
Bundle size may be large for complex apps

output_examples.input: Create a dashboard artifact with React and shadcn/ui
output: Project 'dashboard-demo' initialized with React, Vite, Tailwind CSS, and 40+ shadcn/ui components
Components available: Button, Card, Table, Dialog, Form, Charts, Navigation
Run 'cd dashboard-demo && pnpm dev' to start development server
Run 'bash scripts/bundle-artifact.sh' to create bundle.html artifact

best_practices: Run the bundle script only after completing development to ensure the artifact reflects the final state
Use path aliases (@/) consistently across components for maintainable imports
Test the artifact in a browser before sharing to catch any rendering issues
anti_patterns: Avoid using this skill for simple single-file HTML artifacts that do not need React or state management
Do not skip testing the bundled HTML file before sharing in conversations
Avoid large external dependencies that would significantly increase bundle size

faq.question: What is the difference between this skill and simple HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: This skill is for complex artifacts requiring React state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components. Simple static HTML does not need this setup.

faq.question: What Node.js version is required?
faq.answer: Node.js version 18 or higher is required. The script detects your version and adjusts Vite compatibility accordingly.

faq.question: Can I use npm or yarn instead of pnpm?
faq.answer: The scripts require pnpm. You can convert the project to npm or yarn afterward, but the initialization uses pnpm commands.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. The scripts only create files in the specified project directory. They do not access or transmit any sensitive data.

faq.question: Why is the bundle size large?
faq.answer: Bundled artifacts include React, all dependencies, and CSS inline. This is expected for self-contained HTML files.

faq.question: How does this compare to writing raw HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: This approach enables modern development practices, component reuse, and access to the shadcn/ui design system at the cost of increased bundle size.
